comments:
I've tried to use VE in existing Eclipse projects, I'm using Eclipse 3.0M8 and
the VE, GEF and EMF for this Version (1.0.0 beta).
Its a little bit difficult to explain, so sorry for this bugreport:
On some projects I can actually use the VE normally. In some other projects I
can't. I already tried to remove all librarys and all references from this
projects with no success.

Here you will get a screenshot as well as the Stacktrace for this Exception:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ve.java.core 4 0 Mai 21, 2004 13:34:21.53
!MESSAGE Exception thrown.
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.java.ExpressionDecoderFactory.getExpDecoder(ExpressionDecoderFactory.java:98)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.model.BeanPart.setEObject(BeanPart.java:470)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.model.BeanPart.createEObject(BeanPart.java:798)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.core.JavaSourceTranslator.createJavaInstances(JavaSourceTranslator.java:626)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.core.JavaSourceTranslator.buildCompositionModel(JavaSourceTranslator.java:707)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.core.JavaSourceTranslator.decodeDocument(JavaSourceTranslator.java:816)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.core.JavaSourceTranslator.loadModel(JavaSourceTranslator.java:589)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.editorpart.JavaVisualEditorPart$Setup.run(JavaVisualEditorPart.java:1278)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:62)

Created an attachment (id=10940)
Screenshot showing the problem

Additionally:
Ive tried to use the Wizard for creating a new Swing JFrame or Swing JPanel, as
well as opening an existing JPanel with no success.

Are the failing projects Java projects? This is a pre-req for running the 
Visual Editor. Also check your properties of each failing Java project. Select 
Java Build Path and select the Libraries page. This should list the JRE System 
Library (at least JDK 1.4.2). Otherwise the VE can't load the AWT or Swing 
classes.

Yes, it is already a Java project, it also has the JDK assiged to the project,
as in the other projects.

Created an attachment (id=10974)
.classpath file of one failing project

Created an attachment (id=10975)
.project file of one failing project

Can you attach a small project with the minimal jars needed that has this
problem so we can try to recreate your scenario. I don't see anything wrong with
your classpath or .project file.

I would also recommend stepping up to the latest VE integration build
(I20040603a) just to see if it's still a problem.
Works actually with latest Strem Build and Eclipse 3RC1
1.0M2 is out, so these are now closed in M2.
